Assembly Tools

Best viewed in 1024x768
All the TI-86 development tools needed for programming Z80 assembler shall be located here.

General:

  • Bmp2Gray - A converter from BMP to Grayscale
  • Pic2RLE - Title screen compressor (the zip file also includes Bmp2Asm)
  • Bmp2Asm - A 128x64 1-bit B/W .BMP --> .db converter. Useful for Title Screens.  (best if used with Pic2RLE)
  • Snap86 - Asm TSR that takes a snapshot of a program and saves it as an image.
  • Rom86 - ROM Dump 86 will allow you to dump your calc's ROM out the linkport.
  • 86p2Hex - Converts .86p asm programs into a hex listing so they can be typed into the calc
Assemblers/Disassemblers:
  • Asm86 III - The complete utility to create assembly programs for the TI-86
  • TASM 3.01 - Table Assembler - Used with Asm86
  • TASM80.TAB - Updated Table file for TASM
  • 86 Small-C - A Small-C compiler, peephole optimizer, assembler and relocating linker.
  • Decomp86 - An assembly language decompiler for the TI-86
Graphic/Sprite Editors:
  • Sprite Editor
  • ...Sprite Editor's required OCX and DLL files
Integrated Development Enviroments:
  • Assembly Studio 86 v3.0a - Full blown Z80 IDE with documentation, imbedded sprite editor, user configurable tools menu, calc explorer and more
Emulators:
  • TI-8x Emulator Ver 0.2 Beta 1 - This DOS Program emulates the TI-82, 83, 85, and 86. It also emulates grayscale, the TI-Graphlink, and the speaker.
  • TI-86 Emulator Ver 0.6 - A free MS Windows based program that emulates your TI-86 calculator in a window
Coding Libraries:
  • Grayscale Library v1.0 - 4 and 8 grayscale shade library (uses interrupts)
More Information:
  • Small C compiler Homepage
  • Jimmy Mardell's Homepage
  • Alan Bailey's Homepage
  • Trent Lillehaugen's A86 site
  • Dan Eble's Homepage
